div.head: Statistics
div.p: These are some statistics on variant types, generated through a Python script that processes the XML code:

list.item:
Total <app> elements: 4817, of which:
1786 have @type="substantive"
156 @type="transposition" (note that each transposition is recorded in two 'app' elements, so the actual number of transpositions is 78)
1662 @type="orthographic"
15 @type="gap-in-ms"
14 @type="illegible-in-ms"
1184 @type="punctuation"

'App' elements with @type="punctuation" cannot be considered actual MS variants (see paragraph 'Punctuation variants' above). Also 'app' elements with @type="gap-in-ms" and @type="illegible-in-ms" do not correspond to actual variants: they mark gaps or illegible text in the MS.
This leaves us with a total of 3526 actual variants (V), only counting types "substantive", "transposition" (counted once, henceforth) and "orthographic".

Of all variants (V):
50.7% are substantive (SV) 2.2% are transpositions (TV) 47.1% are orthographic (OV)

Of all substantive variants (SV):
88 (2.5% of SV) have @subtype 'num-num' (two different numerals)
210 (% of SV) have @subtype 'missing-in-ms' (integrations)
(% of SV) have @subtype 'missing-in-print' (expunctions)
( of SV) have @subtype 'fs' (confusion between 'f' and 's')
